intro: Campanula tridentata var. barbata, commonly known as the barbed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and trifoliate leaves with a distinctive barbed edge. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, often found in woodland margins and rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized areas.
